comments.author: mscam_de@rakovszky.info
comments.creator: mscam_de@rakovszky.info

comments.text:
Please check this Sunday morning, because I have to find some other errors, for which I might have to write a bug-report.

For me, this error, at least the confirmation and finding the cause is CRITICAL.
I cannot spend months in finding bugs in Firefox. I want to proceed with putting the my information on the net, and I cannot do it, until the - for me - critical errors are identified and either repaired or a workabout is found.
I have no time to repair hundreds of pages later, just because FireFox refuses to display them when IE and its derivatives do.
I want to have the problems analysed by the middle of October 2006, or I will have to declare FireFox to be unsuitable for my site because of the bugs in it.

comments.raw_text:
Test-info changed:
The alert displays now the typeof(TDBGColour)  and typeof(DataBGColour) instead of the value of TDBGColour. typeof(TDBGColour) is undefined while typeof(DataBGColour) is string.

This change allows test cases further bugs

comments.raw_text:
Further diagnostic line added:
Now  the type of all 7 constants are displayed.
The type of the original 3 are string, those of the last 4 (the added ones) is undefined.
On checking the hex code of the file/library: RakoLibs/InfoBGColours.js does not display any discrepancies.

comments.author: mscam_de@rakovszky.info
comments.raw_text:
1.) Test-case modified:
Variables in InfoBGColours.js renemed: name the 4 causing problem is prefixed with "t", and the definitions are now in the library module PicGaleryFuncs.js.
On my PC (windows 2000 pro english, Windows directory:"Win2K" - a lean win-98 is installed in directory "Windows") the variables in InfoBGColours.js are still undefined, while the copies of the originals are recognised as strings.


The test was carried out also on a PC running German version of Windows XP Home, and FireFox
Firefox info:
File size: 7.190.637 bytes
File Date: Win XP: 2006 Sept 17  18:34:48 or Win-2k: 2006 Sept.20
File-Version: 1.8.0.7: 2006090918
Product version: 1.05.00.07

Please test this bug on another Win-2000 PC to confirm the error, or to find out, if it is misbehaving only on my PC.
(I had an older version of FF installed, then FF-2.
Because of the errors and advice on the FireFox site, I deinstalled both older versions and installed the newest copy, as requested. (It is in another directory)
It could be, that the error lies not in FireFox itself, but is caused by some instalation/deinstallation error resulting in a corrupt system.

To make certain, that the plentitude of errors I observe, are not due to a corrupt system, please:
1.) Check if the error is reproducable on an other Win-2k PC.
If yes, then it is specific to win-2k, if not, 
2.)suggest a safe way to remove FireFox completely, and its all old rubbish before installing again.
3.) What would you prefer that I install if reinstallation is needed
 FF-1 or FF-2?

URGENT!!!
comments.text:
1.) Test-case modified:
Variables in InfoBGColours.js renemed: name the 4 causing problem is prefixed with "t", and the definitions are now in the library module PicGaleryFuncs.js.
On my PC (windows 2000 pro english, Windows directory:"Win2K" - a lean win-98 is installed in directory "Windows") the variables in InfoBGColours.js are still undefined, while the copies of the originals are recognised as strings.


The test was carried out also on a PC running German version of Windows XP Home, and FireFox
Firefox info:
File size: 7.190.637 bytes
File Date: Win XP: 2006 Sept 17  18:34:48 or Win-2k: 2006 Sept.20
File-Version: 1.8.0.7: 2006090918
Product version: 1.05.00.07

Please test this bug on another Win-2000 PC to confirm the error, or to find out, if it is misbehaving only on my PC.
(I had an older version of FF installed, then FF-2.
Because of the errors and advice on the FireFox site, I deinstalled both older versions and installed the newest copy, as requested. (It is in another directory)
It could be, that the error lies not in FireFox itself, but is caused by some instalation/deinstallation error resulting in a corrupt system.

To make certain, that the plentitude of errors I observe, are not due to a corrupt system, please:
1.) Check if the error is reproducable on an other Win-2k PC.
If yes, then it is specific to win-2k, if not, 
2.)suggest a safe way to remove FireFox completely, and its all old rubbish before installing again.
3.) What would you prefer that I install if reinstallation is needed
 FF-1 or FF-2?

URGENT!!!

At last I was able to reinstall FF-2, after removing all traces of previous installationa (as far as I could).
I am happy to report that FF is working as it should be, even in changing the background-colours of table entries.

It is now clear, that the problem was probably caused by having FF-1 and an FF-2 beta installed at the same time, but in different directories.

Is FF prepared for such double-installation? If yes, please check, if not why not? They should be isolated, at least at the beta/RC stage, so that the user could carry on with his normal surfing, even if he finds some erroe in the new version.
comments.raw_text:
At last I was able to reinstall FF-2, after removing all traces of previous installationa (as far as I could).
I am happy to report that FF is working as it should be, even in changing the background-colours of table entries.

It is now clear, that the problem was probably caused by having FF-1 and an FF-2 beta installed at the same time, but in different directories.

Is FF prepared for such double-installation? If yes, please check, if not why not? They should be isolated, at least at the beta/RC stage, so that the user could carry on with his normal surfing, even if he finds some erroe in the new version.

comments.text:
This bug was reported on Firefox 2.x or older, which is no longer supported and will not be receiving any more updates. I strongly suggest that you update to Firefox 3.6.3 or later, update your plugins (flash, adobe, etc.), and retest in a new profile. If you still see the issue with the updated Firefox, please post here. Otherwise, please close as RESOLVED > WORKSFORME
http://www.mozilla.com
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+mode

comments.text: No reply, INCOMPLETE. Please retest with Firefox 3.6.x or later and a new profile (http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles). If you continue to see this issue with the newest firefox and a new profile, then please comment on this bug.
